tuv.seg: Sentencing at criminal trials in Ireland
Gearradh pionóis ag trialacha coiriúla in Éirinn
Sentencing involves a judge deciding what the criminal justice system should do with a person found guilty of an offence
Is éard atá i gceist le gearradh pionóis ná breitheamh ag déanamh cinneadh faoi céard ba cheart don chóras ceartas coiriúil a dhéanamh le duine a fuarthas ciontach i gcion
If a court in Ireland has found you guilty or you have pleaded guilty, the judge will decide the sentence that is to be imposed on you
Má chinneann cúirt in Éirinn go bhfuil tú ciontach i gcoir nó go bhfuil tú tar éis pléadáil ciontach, déanfaidh an breitheamh cinneadh faoin bpianbhreith atá le gearradh ort
For some offences, there are minimum and maximum sentences that the judge must impose
I gcás chionta áirithe, tá íos-phianbhreith agus uas-phianbhreith nach mór don bhreitheamh a ghearradh
For example, for some road traffic offences, the judge is obliged to disqualify offenders from driving for a minimum of two years
Mar shampla, i gcás cionta tráchta ar bhóithre áirithe, ní mór don bhreitheamh ciontóirí a dhícháiliú ó thiomáint ar feadh dhá bhliain ar a laghad
There are mandatory sentences for some offences
Tá pianbhreitheanna éigeantacha ann i gcomhair cionta áirithe
For example, if a court finds you guilty of murder, the judge is obliged to impose a sentence of imprisonment for life
Mar shampla, má chinneann cúirt go bhfuil tú ciontach as dúnmharú, ní mór don bhreitheamh pianbhreith príosúnacht saoil a ghearradh ort
Under the Probation of Offenders Act 1907, a judge in the District Court may decide that the facts alleged against you have been proven but may decide not to convict you

Faoin Probation of Offenders Act 1907, is féidir le breitheamh sa Chúirt Dúiche cinneadh a dhéanamh go bhfuil na fíorais atá curtha i do leith cruthaithe ach cinneadh a dhéanamh freisin gan tú a chiontú
This is a form of second chance which the judge has the discretion to apply
Is cineál dara seans atá i gceist anseo a bhfuil an discréid ag an mbreitheamh é a chur i bhfeidhm
The charge may be dismissed or you may be conditionally discharged
Is féidir an cúiseamh i do choinne a dhíbhiú nó is féidir go ndéanfaí tú a urscaoileadh ar choinníolla
The information given here relates to offences committed by adults
Baineann an fhaisnéis a thugtar anseo le cionta a rinne daoine fásta
Children (that is, people aged under 18) can be charged and penalised in the way described here but there are other considerations which must be taken into account
Is féidir leanaí (is é sin, daoine faoi 18 bliana d'aois) a chúiseamh agus pionós a ghearradh orthu ar an mbealach a ndéantar cur síos air anseo, ach tá rudaí eile nach mór a thógáil san áireamh
The prosecution of children is governed by the Children Act 2001
Rialaíonn Acht na Leanaí 2001 ionchúiseamh leanaí
In practice, children under the age of 12 are almost never prosecuted
I gcleachtas, is fíor-annamh a ionchúisítear leanaí faoi 12 bliana d'aois
It is policy to avoid the prosecution of children under the age of 18 unless the conditions for the Garda Diversion Programme have not been met or the offence is a particularly serious one
Tá sé mar bheartas ionchúiseamh leanaí faoi 18 bliana d'aois a sheachaint mura bhfuil na coinníollacha do Chlár Atreoraithe an Gharda bainte amach nó más cion an-tromchúiseach atá i gceist
The Childrens Act 2001 provides for a range of alternative penalties for children who have offended
Cuireann Acht na Leanaí 2001 raon pionós malartach ar fáil do leanaí a bhfuil cionta déanta acu

The Criminal Justice Act 2006 (pdf) sets the age in relation to criminal responsibility. Children under 12 may not be charged with most criminal offences but children age 10 or 11 can be charged with the offences of murder, manslaughter, rape or aggravated sexual assault

Leagann An tAcht um Cheartas Coiriúil 2006 (pdf) síos an aois maidir le freagracht choiriúil Ní féidir leanaí faoi 12 bliana d'aois a chúiseamh as formhór cionta coiriúla ach is féidir leanaí atá 10 nó 11 bliana d'aois a chúiseamh as cionta dúnmharaithe, dúnorgana, éignithe nó tromionsaithe gnéis
You can read more about criminal responsibility in the document Children and the criminal justice system
Is féidir leat tuilleadh a léamh faoi fhreagracht choiriúil sa doiciméad Leanaí agus an Córas Ceartais Choiriúil
Under the Irish legal system it is always a judge (a panel of judges in the case of the Special Criminal Court or the Court of Appeal) who imposes the sentence
Faoi chóras dlí na hÉireann, is breitheamh (nó painéal breithiúna i gcás na Cúirte Coiriúla Speisialta nó na Cúirte Achomhairc) a ghearann an pionós i gcónaí
In jury trials in the Circuit Criminal Court and the Central Criminal Court, the jury’s role is to decide whether you are guilty or not guilty
I dtrialacha giúiré sa Chúirt Chuarda Choiriúil agus sa Phríomh-Chúirt Choiriúil, is é an ról atá ag an ngiúire ná cinneadh a dhéanamh an bhfuil tú ciontach nó neamhchiontach
The jury has no role in sentencing you
Níl aon pháirt ag an ngiúiré i ngearradh pionóis ort
This decision is left up to the judge after listening to your legal representative's (that is, your solicitor’s or barrister's) submission
Fágtar an cinneadh sin faoin mbreitheamh i ndiaidh dó/di éisteacht le haighneacht d'ionadaí dlí (is é sin do aturnae nó do abhcóide)
How does a judge decide on a sentence?
Conas a dhéanann breitheamh cinneadh maidir le pianbhreith?
When considering what sentence to impose on you, the judge follows a two-step procedure:
Nuair atá cinneadh á dhéanamh aige/aici faoin bpianbhreith atá le gearradh ort, leanann an breitheamh nós imeachta ina bhfuil dhá chéim:
Decide what the sentence should be in light of the seriousness of the offence
Cinneadh a dhéanamh cén pianbhreith ar chóir a bheith ann mar gheall ar cé chomh tromchúiseach is a bhí an cion
Reduce that sentence in the light of any mitigating or excusing factors given on your behalf
Laghdú a dhéanamh ar an bpianbhreith sin mar gheall ar aon fhachtóirí maolaitheacha a thugtar ar do shon
There are a number of important factors that a judge must have regard to, when sentencing you
Tá roinnt fachtóirí tábhachtacha nach mór don bhreitheamh a thógáil san áireamh agus é ag gearradh pionóis ort
It is a matter for your solicitor or barrister, on your behalf, to urge the judge to consider these factors and what weight or importance should be given to each
Is faoi d'aturnae nó d'abhcóide atá sé iarraidh ar an mbreitheamh iad seo a thógáil san áireamh, agus an tábhacht ar chóir a thabhairt do gach ceann acu
When deciding which sentence to impose on you, the judge considers:
Nuair atá cinneadh á dhéanamh aige faoin bpianbhreith atá le gearradh ort, tógann an breitheamh na nithe seo a leanas san áireamh:
• Whether or not you pleaded guilty to the offence
• Ar phléadáil tú ciontach as an gcion nó nár dhéan
• The facts of the offence - the circumstances in which the offence occurred
• Fíorais an chiona - na cúinsí inar tharla an cion
• Whether there were any aggravating factors in relation to the offence - such as particularly violent or cruel behaviour
• An raibh aon fachtóirí a dhéanfadh forthromú ann maidir leis an gcion - mar shampla iompar cruálach nó foréigneach thar an ngnáth
• Your previous criminal record
• Do thaifead coiriúil roimhe sin
• Whether you are employed
• An bhfuil tú fostaithe nó nach bhfuil
• Whether you are sorry for what you have done
• An bhfuil aiféala ort as an méid a rinne tú
• Whether certain types of treatment may help or reform you
• An dtabharfaidh cineálacha áirithe cóireála cúnamh duit nó an ndéanfaidh siad athleasú ort
• The impact of the offence on the victim
• An tionchar a bhí ag an gcion ar an íospartach
• Any other relevant information about you (for example, if you are in bad health)
• Aon fhaisnéis ábharthach eile fút (mar shampla, an bhfuil droch-shláinte ag dul duit)
See "Further information" below on the factors considered
Féach ‘Tuilleadh eolais’ thíos ar na fachtóirí a thógtar san áireamh
There are a large range of sentences available to judges that can be imposed on someone found guilty of an offence
Tá réimse leathan pianbhreitheanna ar fáil do bhreithiúna gur féidir a ghearradh ar dhuine a fhaightear ciontach i gcion
These can be classified as follows:
Is féidir iad seo a rangú mar seo a leanas:
• Curfew, exclusion and restriction on movement orders
• Cuirfiú, eisiamh agus orduithe srianta ar ghluaiseacht
There are a number of secondary options available to judges, depending on the offence:
Tá roinnt roghanna tánaisteacha ar fáil do bhreithiúna, ag brath ar an gcion:
• Endorsement and penalty points for road traffic offences
• Formhuiniú agus pointí pionóis i gcomhair cionta tráchta ar bhóithre
There are additional options for sex and drug trafficking offenders
Tá roghanna breise ann i gcomhair ciontóirí gnéis agus gáinneála drugaí
You can read more about sentencing in the document on types of sentences
Is féidir leat tuilleadh a léamh faoi ghearradh pionóis sa chaipéis ar chineálacha pianbhreitheanna
Information on sentencing decisions is available on the Irish Sentencing Information System website
Tá faisnéis maidir le cinntí pianbhreithe atá ar fáil ar láithreán gréasáin an Phianbhreitheanna na hÉireann Córas Faisnéise
Factors to be considered by a judge in sentencing
Fachtóirí atá le tógáil san áireamh ag breitheamh agus pionós á ghearradh aige

There are a number of important factors that a sentencing judge must have regard to when sentencing you. It is a matter for your solicitor or barrister, on your behalf, to urge the judge to consider these factors and what weight or importance should be given to each

Tá roinnt fachtóirí tábhachtacha nach mór do bhreitheamh aird a thabhairt orthu agus tú á chiontú aige Is faoi d'aturnae nó d'abhcóide atá sé iarraidh ar an mbreitheamh iad seo a thógáil san áireamh, agus an tábhacht ar chóir a thabhairt do gach ceann acu
Facts surrounding the commission of the offence
Na cúinsí a bhaineann le cur i gcrích an chiona
The circumstances in which the offence occurred might include:
I measc na gcúinsí ina bhféadfadh an cion tarlú tá:
• Provocation (were you provoked into committing the offence)
• Bríogadh (bríogadh tú chun an cion a dhéanamh)
• Duress or emotional stress (were you under emotional pressure)
• Éigeantas nó strus mothúchánach (bhí brú mothúchánach ort)
• Low value of goods stolen or damaged
• Luach íseal ag na hearraí a goideadh nó a rinneadh damáiste dóibh
• Recovery of stolen property
• Aisghabháil maoin a goideadh
These types of factors can have a positive effect for you in the judge’s decision on sentencing and are known as mitigating factors
Is féidir le factóirí den chineál seo tionchar dearfach a bheith acu i gcinneadh an bhreithimh maidir le gearradh pionóis agus tugtar factóirí maolaitheacha orthu
However, there may also be factors which can have a negative effect (known as aggravating factors)
Is féidir fachtóirí a bheith ann freisin go bhfuil tionchar diúltach acu (ar a dtugtar fachtóirí forthromaithe)
• Use of a firearm or other weapon
• Úsáid airm tine nó arm eile
• Invasion of someone’s home
• Ionradh ar bhaile dhuine éigin
• On bail for another offence at the time
• Ar bannaí mar gheall ar chion eile ag an am
• High value of goods stolen or damaged
• Luach ard ag na hearraí a goideadh nó a rinneadh damáiste dóibh
• No stolen property recovered
• Níor aisghabhadh aon mhaoin a goideadh
Impact of the offence on the victim
Tionchar ag an gcion ar an íospartach
In most cases of a serious nature, a judge orders that a victim impact report be prepared
I bhformhór cásanna tromchúiseacha, ordaíonn an breitheamh go n-ullmhófaí tuairisc tionchair ar an íospartach
In some cases a judge hears direct evidence from the victim through a victim impact statement (pdf)
I gcásanna áirithe éisteann an breitheamh le fianaise díreach ón íospartach trí ráiteas tionchair íospartaigh (pdf)
This has a bearing on the sentence which a judge decides to impose
Bíonn tionchar aige seo ar an bpianbhreith a shocraíonn an breitheamh a ghearradh
Offenders reaction to committing the offence
Freagairt na gciontóirí ar an gcion a bheith déanta acu
You can expect a reduced sentence for pleading guilty
A bheith ag súil le pianbhreith laghdaithe má phléadálann tú ciontach
In many cases, a guilty plea will save the court time and can be seen as a sign of remorse or sorrow
In go leor cásanna, sábhálfaidh pléadáil chiontach am ar an gcúirt agus is féidir é a fheiceáil mar chomhartha doilís nó bróin
In sex cases or cases involving violence, a guilty plea will spare the victim the trauma of having to relive the events in court
I gcásanna gnéis nó cásanna ina bhfuil foréigean i gceist, ciallóidh pléadáil chiontach nach mbeidh ar an íospartach dul tríd an tráma a bhainfeadh le dul tríd an eachtra arís sa chúirt
While a guilty plea is a mitigating factor, you are still entitled to fight your case without it being seen as an aggravating factor
Cé gur fachtóir maolaitheach atá i bpléadáil chiontach, tá tú fós i dteideal do chás a throid gan é a bheith feicithe mar fhachtóir forthromaithe
There is a constitutional right to be tried in due course of law and nobody is penalised for exercising this constitutional right
Tá ceart bunreachtúil ann triail a bheith agat in am is i dtráth an dlí agus ní chuirfear pionós ar aon duine as ucht úsáid a bhaint as an gceart bunreachtúil seo
The court sees an early admission of guilt to the Gardaí as a mitigating factor as it saves the Gardaí time and resources
Feiceann an chúirt admháil luath chiontachta do na Gardaí mar fhachtóir maolaitheach os rud é go sábhálann sé am agus acmhainní ar na Gardaí
Co-operation with the Gardaí
Comhoibriú leis na Gardaí
Co-operation with the Gardaí also helps you in the sentencing process, especially if it helped the Gardaí in catching other offenders
Tugann comhoibriú leis na Gardaí cúnamh duit sa phróiseas gearradh pionóis, go háirithe má thug sé cabhair do na Gardaí breith ar chiontóirí eile

For example, Section 27 of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1977 as amended provides that this is a factor to be taken into account in deciding whether the minimum 10 year sentence for possession of drugs over a certain value is just and appropriate

Mar shampla, déanann Alt 27 den Acht um Mí-úsáid Drugaí 1977 arna leasú foráil gur fachtóir é seo atá le tógáil san áireamh nuair atá cinneadh á dhéanamh an bhfuil an íos-phianbhreith 10 mbliana ar dhrugaí thar luach áirithe a bheith i do sheilbh agat ceart agus feiliúnach
Personal circumstances of the offender
Cúinsí pearsanta an chiontóra
Your personal circumstances is one of the most important factors a judge considers prior to sentencing and may request a probation report
Tá do chúinsí pearsanta ar cheann de na fachtóirí is tábhachtaí a thógann an breitheamh san áireamh sula ngearrann sé/sí pionós agus is féidir leis iarratas ar thuairisc promhaidh a dhéanamh
